modules.description: Includes a syntax extension that replaces `%blob "filename"` with the raw contents of the specified file as a string, preserving binary and compressed data. Operates on file paths and string literals, embedding file contents directly into the compiled code. Used to bundle external resources like images, configuration files, or binary data without manual encoding.

Provides functions to locate and process blob data, including error reporting with location information, mapping over lists to find first non-optional result, retrieving candidate file paths, reading files, and expanding blob expressions into AST nodes. Operates on location data, strings, and OCaml AST structures. Used to inject or process binary data directly within OCaml code during preprocessing.
